span.strong:
Marlow Public Schools Distance/Virtual Learning Plan Through
the Covid-19 Pandemic
School Schedule April 6, 2020 to May 15, 2020 â€œLast Day of
Schoolâ€
ALL SCHOOL FACILITIES ARE CLOSED!

span.br:
1. The purpose of this guide is to provide answers and expectations during our time of
HISTORIC EVENTS and our Distance Learning.
2. Our hope is to maintain academic opportunities while providing a sense of stability to our
students and their families.
3. Support our patrons in every way possible during a difficult time in history.
4. The focus of the Next Six Weeks of instruction is to teach the following:
Character
Leadership

p.span:
Concern for Others
The Marlow Outlaw Way
The goal of the lessons are to be enrichment and engagement - not rigor. NO PAPER
PACKETS!
Time Framework for students:
Freshmen â€“ Seniors:Â Maximum of 3 hours daily
6-8 Grade -Â Â Maximum of 3 hours daily
4-5 Grade - Maximum of 90 minutes daily
2-3 Grade - Maximum of 60 minutes daily
K-1 Grade - Maximum of 45 minutes daily
Pre-K- Maximum of 30 minutes daily
Faculty/Administrators are encouraged to use virtual platforms for meetings to avoid large
groupings of people. Some of those platforms include but are not limited to: E-MAIL, REMIND
101, ZOOM, SEESAW, PERISCOPE, GOOGLE HANGOUTS, etc.

5. THE SCHOOL CALENDAR WILL BE APRIL 6 THRU MAY 15, 2020, â€œLast Day of
Schoolâ€. We will observe our current school calendar with observations of holiday, snow
days, etc.
6. Breakfast and Lunch is provided FREE to ALL STUDENTS from 9:30 a.m. to 10:30 a.m.
AT ELEMENTARY SCHOOL. DRIVE-THRU SERVICE ONLY.
7. This crisis will in no way be punitive to studentsâ€™ grades, graduation status, or scholarship
opportunities.
8. Administrators who are directly in charge of scheduled activities, events, etc., will begin calling
venues, vendors, etc. to cancel events and determine if deposits will be refunded, etc.
9. Administrators will determine how refunds will be distributed to individuals (ie. Prom tickets,
academic banquet tickets, driverâ€™s ed., PTO, etc.)
10. Getting Studentsâ€™ Possessions back to them and receiving Sports Gear, library books, textbooks,
etc. - It was determined that each site will establish a time when students/family will show up to
retrieve possessions, medications, etc. left at their school site.
11. Each varsity coach will be contacted to schedule a time to turn in gear for participants in the
respective sports. NO GROUPS LARGER THAN 8 MAY BE TOGETHER and SOCIAL
DISTANCING RULES APPLY!
12.Â Administrators and Teachers will personally contact each student at their site to explain
what is going on and see how they will best receive instruction from their
teacher(s).
13. HS principals will contact RRTC and Cameron University to determine the online learning
methods for our students who are enrolled there and to be able to communicate with those
students regarding any difficulties in distance learning at those sites.
14. Administrators will direct Special Education teachers to read each of their IEPâ€™S and complete
paperwork to include distance learning framework. PT/OT/SLP services will be provided in the
manner most conducive to the family.
15. Teacherâ€™s â€œOffice Hoursâ€: Principals will determine with faculty members how/when teachers
will make/have virtual contact with students who need questions answered, reassurance, or just a
supportive word.
16. Driverâ€™s Education: Mr. Harris will coordinate with students/parents a time/place where students
can drive, for course requirements.
17. State Mandated Assessments: No assessments will be given this school year. ACT exam has
been pushed to June 13, 2020, and AP Testing will continue with students testing at home.

18. Reading Sufficiency Act: No screening assessments may be given after March 16, 2020. Any
screenings prior to that date will be sufficient for this yearâ€™s determination of retention or
promotion.
19. Essential Personnel: Workers supporting public and private childcare establishments, PreK
establishments, K-12 schools, colleges, and universities for purposes of distance learning,
provision of school meals, or care and supervision of minors to support essential workforce across
all sectors is the State of Oklahomaâ€™s definition of essential personnel.
20. We will make every attempt to hold a graduation ceremony.
Graduation will be postponed to a later date, possibly July.
Depending on conditions and recommendations from the state and
CDC, it may be necessary to take alternative measures to ensure
that we recognize students. We are currently working on these
measures to recognize students in the event that we remain
restricted.
21. For the NEXT School Year: 2020-2021
IF this pandemic continues, we will have a new program to deliver content and curriculum
to students.
Coaches will plan athletic summer camps, etc., with the ability to cancel them should this
pandemic not end.
Stay out of the athletic facilities, buildings, etc.
22. Contact Information:
If you have any questions or concerns please call the High School office at (580) 658-2718,
Middle School Office at (580) 658-2619 and Elementary School Office at (580) 658-3216
Office Hours: Monday - Thursday from 9:00AM - 12:00 Noon, NO FACE -TO- FACE
MEETING WILL BE ALLOWED.
You may also email:
Bryan Brantley: HS Principal atÂ bbrantley@marlow.k12.ok.us

Jeremy Gage, HS Assistant Principal at jgage@marlow.k12.ok.us
Ross Ridge, MS Principal at rridge@marlow.k12.ok.us
Chad Gilbert, MS Assistant Principal at cgilbert@marlow.k12.ok.us
Kim Kizarr, Elem Principal at kekizarr@marlow,k12.ok.us
Kirk Harris, Elem Assistant Principal at kharris@marlow.k12.ok.

span.strong: COVID-19 UPDATES:

MPS facilities, buildings, transportation, etc. are closed to classes, practices, rehearsals, events,
and all outside groups until at least 4/5/2020.Â

FREE sack breakfasts and lunches (for students 18 and under)Â will be available for pick-up only in the drop-off lane at MES from 9:30-10:30Â a.m beginningÂ 3/23/2020 each weekday. Â NO PUBLIC ACCESS to buildings and no children areÂ Â to be left at any school site.
Â FAMILIES MUST REMAIN IN THEIR VEHICLES!

span.span: Dear Marlow Outlaw Students, Families, and Community Members,

Marlow Public Schools has always had a rich, storied history of taking care of its students and its community.Â Once an Outlaw, ALWAYS an Outlaw!Â To that end, I must share with you some serious news.

After the State Board of Educationâ€™s decision on Wednesday, March 25, 2020, Oklahoma students will not return to the classroom for the remainder of the current school year.Â Instead, school districts, including Marlow, will implement continuous learning plans that will allow students to complete the school year at home.Â State education and health officials believe this will help our state fight the spread of COVID-19.

We want you to be able to prepare accordingly for your family.Â We realize this change is in the best interest of everyoneâ€™s health, which is our greatest priority as a district.Â The state boardâ€™s vote also means that all extracurricular activities and special events will be canceled as well.Â Making these difficult decisions, we believe, is simply the right thing to do for our students, our staff, and our community.

We do have some good news, though: Marlow Public Schools is developing a plan to ensure your child will continue to have opportunities to learn and to grow academically, especially with parental support.Â Because we are unable to safely gather together, these lessons and activities will be delivered to you in various ways.Â Our administration team has spent several hours planning for this effort and will share details with your family as soon as they are finalized.Â We appreciate the efforts of our child nutrition employees in feeding students every week day.Â We appreciate our custodial and maintenance crews as they work to clean and disinfect every building in the district.Â The work of running the district is still going on.

For many students, it likely will be sad and disappointing to receive confirmation that school as they know it will not resume this year.Â For our seniors and their parents, we know it is an especially difficult time.Â We will do everything possible to ensure their efforts are recognized and celebrated in special and unique ways.Â This is an unfair situation, but please reassure them that it does not diminish their achievements.Â

We have posted numerous resources on our website, including information about free breakfasts and lunches for students under the age of 18, which will continue, as well as answers to frequently asked questions regarding the school closure.Â Youâ€™ll also find recommendations from the CDC about protecting your health and the health of your loved ones: (1) washing your hands regularly (2) staying at home, if you can; and (3) practicing social distancing of at least six feet from others.

This is an unprecedented situation, and extraordinary times demand: CHARACTER, LEADERSHIP, CONCERN FOR OTHERS, and THE OUTLAW WAY.Â This community sticks together in challenging times, and we know this experience will be no different.Â As soon as we finalize our next steps, we will share them with you.
Please stay safe.Â Thank you for supporting Marlow Public Schools and GO OUTLAWS!!
Sincerely,
Superintendent
March 23, 2020
Dear Marlow Parents, Staff, and Community Members:

As our country fights the spread of COVID-19, we believe one of our greatest responsibilities is to communicate transparently and often with you, our school community.Â It is our hope that accurate and up-to-date correspondence will help you make well-informed decisions for your family.Â Nothing is more important to MPS than the safety and health of our students, our employees and their families.Â When we work together, we can provide the best care for all involved.

MPS will continue to clean and disinfect surfaces inside all district school sites, facilities, and venues.Â As more cases are being confirmed across the state of Oklahoma, it is important to remain vigilant.Â The CDC recommends the following best practices to help prevent the spread of this global pandemic:
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds.
Use alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol if soap and water are not available.
Avoid close contact with those who are sick.
Cover your coughs and sneezes with a tissue or your sleeve.
Avoid touching your eyes, mouth, and nose.
Disinfect frequently touched surfaces and objects.
Stay at home, if possible.
If you must go out, practice social distancing, leaving at least six feet between you and other people.
Avoid gatherings that include more than TEN (10) people.

Symptoms of COVID-19 include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.Â If you or any member of your family exhibits these symptoms, you are encouraged to contact your medical provider for advice immediately.Â Symptoms usually appear 2-14 days after exposure.
If you would like to learn more about COVID-19 visit the following links:Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â
Our greatest priority is the safety of our students, staff, and community members.Â Please continue to take necessary precautions to protect yourself and those around you.
We are grateful for the opportunity to serve you and your family, especially as we face this challenging situation together.Â Thank you for your support of Marlow Public Schools.
Sincerely,

span.strong: George E. Coffman, Jr.

span.span: Superintendent

span.strong: March 17, 2020
Dear Parents and Families,

strong.span: The Oklahoma State Board of Education held an emergency meeting the afternoon of March 16, 2020,Â resulting in a mandate that all public schools in Oklahoma close from March 17 through April 6, 2020. This includes all extracurricular activities.

Members of the Marlow Public Schools administration team has metÂ to plan for continuing to serve our students during this time.Information on meal service through our child nutrition program for students 18 years old and youngerÂ is listed above.

The Marlow Public Schools leadership team is working diligently with top leaders in our state to stay abreast of the most recent developments. As our understanding of the coronavirus/COVID-19 pandemic changes rapidly, itâ€™s important for our community to remain calm and continue to practice preventative measures such as good hand hygiene, staying home when sick, avoiding large crowds and social distancing.

The health of our students and staff continues to be our number one priority. If you believe you have been exposed to the coronavirus/COVID-19 and/or have symptoms, immediately self-quarantine and contact the COVID-19 Call Center at (877) 215-8336 or call Stephens County Health Dept.Â 580-252-0270.Â
Thank you for your help in keeping our community healthy and safe. We will update information as it becomes available.

center.p: YOU HAVE LIKELY SEEN A LOT OF RECENT MEDIA ATTENTION ON THE CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19).Â THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION IS PROVIDED TO HELP PREVENT THE TRANSMISSION AND SPREAD OF CORONAVIRUS .Â THE VIRUS, LIKE MANY OTHER ILLNESSES INCLUDING THE FLU, IS SPREAD BETWEEN PEOPLE WHO ARE IN CLOSE CONTACT WITH ONE ANOTHER (WITHIN ABOUT 6â€™) VIA COUGHING OR SNEEZING.Â THE SAME GOOD HEALTH HABITS THAT PREVENT OTHER VIRUSES LIKE THE FLU, ALSO PREVENT THE SPREAD OF CORONAVIRUS AND DECREASE THE RISK OF GETTING SICK:
--WASH YOUR HANDS OFTEN WITH SOAP AND WATER FOR AT LEAST 20 SECONDS.Â USE AN ALCOHOL-BASED HAND SANITIZER, WITH 60% ALCOHOL, IF SOAP AND WATER ARE NOT AVAILABLE.Â
--COUGH INTO A TISSUE OR YOUR ELBOW (NOT YOUR HAND), THEN THROW TISSUE AWAY AND WASH YOUR HANDS. --AVOID TOUCHING YOUR EYES, NOSE, OR MOUTH WITH UNWASHED HANDS.
--AVOID CONTACT WITH PEOPLE WHO ARE SICK AND STAY HOME WHEN YOU ARE SICK. --KEEP STUDENTS HOME IF THEY ARE RUNNING A TEMPERATURE OR THEY REPORT NOT FEELING WELL OR APPEAR WEAK OR ILL.
--CONSULT YOUR HEALTHCARE PROVIDER IF YOU OR YOUR CHILD HAS HEALTH CONDITIONS THAT PUT YOU AT INCREASED RISK.

WE AT MARLOW PUBLIC SCHOOLS ARE COMMITTED TO KEEPING YOU INFORMED AND WORKING WITH YOU TO KEEP OUR SCHOOL COMMUNITY SAFE.Â FOR MORE COVID-19 FACTS, VISIT THIS WEBSITE:Â Â HTTPS://WWW.CDC.GOV/CORONAVIRUS/2019-NCOV/ABOUT/SHARE-FACTS.HTML

span.span: EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES:
HS SPANISH TEACHER
MS MATH TEACHER w/ possible coaching
ES TEACHER(S)
Please send letter of application and resume to Marlow Public Schools. Attn: George E. Coffman, Jr., Supt.
The positions will be filled as soon as possible.
TRANSCEND!
Go beyond the limits!
